blocks.name: f1ocnvdm
blocks.content: The value of the converse of a one-to-one onto function belongs to its domain. (Contributed by NM, 26-May-2006.)

blocks.name: f1ocnvfvrneq
blocks.content: If the values of a one-to-one function for two arguments from the range of the function are equal, the arguments themselves must be equal. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 12-Nov-2017.)

blocks.name: fcof1
blocks.content: An application is injective if a retraction exists. Proposition 8 of [BourbakiEns] p. E.II.18. (Contributed by FL, 11-Nov-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm fcof1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wf1(c0, c1, c2))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c0, c1, c2), wral(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wi(wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))
  simpl(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1)))
  ralrimivva(hs0, hs1, c1, c1, wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wi(wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  expr(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  3eqtr3d(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), cfv(cres(cid, c1), cv(hs0)), cfv(cres(cid, c1), cv(hs1)), wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))
  3eqtr3d(cfv(cres(cid, c1), cv(hs0)), cfv(cres(cid, c1), cv(hs1)), cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs1)), wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))
  3eqtr4d(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs1)), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))
  fveq2d(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))
  simprr(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))), wceq(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), wf(c0, c1, c2), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  fvco3(c0, c1, c2, cv(hs0), c3)
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))), wceq(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs1)), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))), wf(c0, c1, c2), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))
  simpll(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))
  fvco3(c0, c1, c2, cv(hs1), c3)
  fveq1d(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0), cres(cid, c1), wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))
  fveq1d(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs1), cres(cid, c1), wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))
  simplr(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))
  syl(wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))), wceq(cfv(cres(cid, c1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  simprll(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))
  fvresi(cv(hs0), c1)
  syl(wa(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))), wceq(cfv(cres(cid, c1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))
  simprlr(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))
  fvresi(cv(hs1), c1)
  dff13(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))))
  diff.hs1.w(wa(wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1))))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: fcofo
blocks.content: An application is surjective if a section exists. Proposition 8 of [BourbakiEns] p. E.II.18. (Contributed by FL, 17-Nov-2011.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 27-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm fcofo(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2))), wfo(c0, c1, c2))
} = {
  sylanbrc(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2))), wfo(c0, c1, c2), wf(c0, c1, c2), wral(hs0, c2, wrex(hs1, c1, wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))
  simp1(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2)))
  ralrimiva(hs0, c2, w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2))), wrex(hs1, c1, wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wrex(hs1, c1, wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))))
  3ad2antl2(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), c1))
  ffvelrn(c3, c2, c1, cv(hs0))
  3eqtr3rd(cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cfv(ccom(c0, c3), cv(hs0)), cfv(cres(cid, c2), cv(hs0)), wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  fveq1d(ccom(c0, c3), cv(hs0), cres(cid, c2), wa(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  simpl3(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  3ad2antl2(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(ccom(c0, c3), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))))
  fvco3(c3, c2, c1, cv(hs0), c0)
  adantl(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(cres(cid, c2), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)))
  fvresi(cv(hs0), c2)
  rspceeqv(hs1, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), c1, cv(hs0), cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs1), cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), c0)
  dffo3(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.w(w3a(wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2))))
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0))))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: cbvfo
blocks.content: Change bound variable between domain and range of function. (Contributed by NM, 23-Feb-1997.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cbvfo(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wb(wral(s0, c1, w0), wral(s1, c2, w1)))
  -| wi(wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  bitr3d(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wral(s0, c1, w0), wral(s1, c2, w1), wral(s1, crn(c0), w1))
  syl(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wb(wral(s1, crn(c0), w1), wral(s0, c1, w0)), wfn(c0, c1))
  fofn(c0, c1, c2)
  ralrn(s1, s0, c0, c1, w1, w0)
  eqcoms(cv(s1), cfv(c0, cv(s0)), wb(w1, w0))
  bicomd(wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), w1, w0)
  raleqdv(s1, crn(c0), c2, wfo(c0, c1, c2), w1)
  forn(c0, c1, c2)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.crn.s(s1, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cbvfo(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 : c1 ↠ c2)→(∀(s0 ∈ c1, w0)↔ ∀(s1 ∈ c2, w1)))
  ⊣ ((c0 ` s0)= s1 →(w0 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w1)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  bitr3d((c0 : c1 ↠ c2), ∀(s0 ∈ c1, w0), ∀(s1 ∈ c2, w1), ∀(s1 ∈ ran(c0), w1))
  syl((c0 : c1 ↠ c2), (∀(s1 ∈ ran(c0), w1)↔ ∀(s0 ∈ c1, w0)), c0[Fn]c1)
  fofn(c0, c1, c2)
  ralrn(s1, s0, c0, c1, w1, w0)
  eqcoms(s1, (c0 ` s0), (w1 ↔ w0))
  bicomd((c0 ` s0)= s1, w1, w0)
  raleqdv(s1, ran(c0), c2, (c0 : c1 ↠ c2), w1)
  forn(c0, c1, c2)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.crn.s(s1, c0)
}

blocks.name: cbvexfo
blocks.content: Change bound variable between domain and range of function. (Contributed by NM, 23-Feb-1997.)
blocks.origin:
thm cbvexfo(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wb(wrex(s0, c1, w0), wrex(s1, c2, w1)))
  -| wi(wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  3bitr4g(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wrex(s0, c1, w0), wrex(s1, c2, w1), wn(wral(s0, c1, wn(w0))), wn(wral(s1, c2, wn(w1))))
  notbid(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wral(s0, c1, wn(w0)), wral(s1, c2, wn(w1)))
  cbvfo(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, wn(w0), wn(w1))
  notbid(wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), w0, w1)
  dfrex2(s0, c1, w0)
  dfrex2(s1, c2, w1)
  diff.wn.s(s0, w1)
  diff.wn.s(s1, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cbvexfo(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 : c1 ↠ c2)→(∃(s0 ∈ c1, w0)↔ ∃(s1 ∈ c2, w1)))
  ⊣ ((c0 ` s0)= s1 →(w0 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, w1)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  3bitr4g((c0 : c1 ↠ c2), ∃(s0 ∈ c1, w0), ∃(s1 ∈ c2, w1), ¬ ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ¬ w0), ¬ ∀(s1 ∈ c2, ¬ w1))
  notbid((c0 : c1 ↠ c2), ∀(s0 ∈ c1, ¬ w0), ∀(s1 ∈ c2, ¬ w1))
  cbvfo(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, ¬ w0, ¬ w1)
  notbid((c0 ` s0)= s1, w0, w1)
  dfrex2(s0, c1, w0)
  dfrex2(s1, c2, w1)
  diff.wn.s(s0, w1)
  diff.wn.s(s1, w0)
}

blocks.name: cocan1

thm cocan1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

  bitrd(wa(w3a(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wceq(cfv(ccom(c0, c3), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c0, c5), cv(hs0))), wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cfv(c5, cv(hs0))), wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cfv(c0, cfv(c5, cv(hs0)))))
  eqeq12d(cfv(ccom(c0, c3), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c0, c5), cv(hs0)), cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cfv(c0, cfv(c5, cv(hs0))), wa(w3a(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c4)))

  fvco3(c3, c4, c1, cv(hs0), c0)

  fvco3(c5, c4, c1, cv(hs0), c0)
  syl12anc(wa(w3a(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wb(wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cfv(c0, cfv(c5, cv(hs0)))), wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cfv(c5, cv(hs0)))), wf1(c0, c1, c2), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), c1), wcel(cfv(c5, cv(hs0)), c1))
  simpl1(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c4))
  3ad2antl2(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), c1))
  ffvelrn(c3, c4, c1, cv(hs0))
  3ad2antl3(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cfv(c5, cv(hs0)), c1))
  ffvelrn(c5, c4, c1, cv(hs0))
  f1fveq(c0, c1, c2, cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cfv(c5, cv(hs0)))
  syl2anc(w3a(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1)), wb(wceq(ccom(c0, c3), ccom(c0, c5)), wral(hs0, c4, wceq(cfv(ccom(c0, c3), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c0, c5), cv(hs0))))), wfn(ccom(c0, c3), c4), wfn(ccom(c0, c5), c4))
  syl2anc(w3a(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1)), wfn(ccom(c0, c3), c4), wfn(c0, c1), wf(c3, c4, c1))
  fnfco(c0, c1, c3, c4)
  syl2anc(w3a(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1)), wfn(ccom(c0, c5), c4), wfn(c0, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1))
  ffnd(c0, c1, c2, w3a(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1)))
  3ad2ant1(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1), wf(c0, c1, c2))
  f1f(c0, c1, c2)
  fnfco(c0, c1, c5, c4)

  ffnd(c3, c4, c1, w3a(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1)))
  simp2(wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c4, c1), wf(c5, c4, c1))

  eqfnfv(hs0, c3, c4, c5)

  diff.hs0.c(ccom(c0, c3))

blocks.name: cocan2
blocks.content: A surjection is right-cancelable. (Contributed by FL, 21-Nov-2011.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cocan2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wb(wceq(ccom(c3, c0), ccom(c4, c0)), wceq(c3, c4)))
} = {
  3bitr4d(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), ccom(c4, c0)), wceq(c3, c4), wral(hs0, c1, wceq(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c4, c0), cv(hs0)))), wral(hs1, c2, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cfv(c4, cv(hs1)))))
  bitrd(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wral(hs0, c1, wceq(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c4, c0), cv(hs0)))), wral(hs1, c2, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cfv(c4, cv(hs1)))), wral(hs0, c1, wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))))
  ralbidva(hs0, c1, w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wceq(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c4, c0), cv(hs0))), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))
  eqeq12d(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c4, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), wa(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  sylan(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), wf(c0, c1, c2))
  fvco3(c0, c1, c2, cv(hs0), c3)
  sylan(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cfv(ccom(c4, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), wf(c0, c1, c2))
  fvco3(c0, c1, c2, cv(hs0), c4)
  3ad2ant1(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2), wb(wral(hs0, c1, wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))))), wral(hs1, c2, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cfv(c4, cv(hs1))))))
  cbvfo(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2, wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))), wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cfv(c4, cv(hs1))))
  eqeq12d(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cfv(c4, cv(hs1)), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))
  fveq2(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1), c3)
  fveq2(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cv(hs1), c4)
  syl2anc(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wb(wceq(ccom(c3, c0), ccom(c4, c0)), wral(hs0, c1, wceq(cfv(ccom(c3, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(ccom(c4, c0), cv(hs0))))), wfn(ccom(c3, c0), c1), wfn(ccom(c4, c0), c1))
  syl2anc(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wfn(ccom(c3, c0), c1), wfn(c3, c2), wf(c0, c1, c2))
  fnfco(c3, c2, c0, c1)
  syl2anc(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wfn(ccom(c4, c0), c1), wfn(c4, c2), wf(c0, c1, c2))
  3ad2ant1(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2), wf(c0, c1, c2))
  fof(c0, c1, c2)
  fnfco(c4, c2, c0, c1)
  eqfnfv(hs0, ccom(c3, c0), c1, ccom(c4, c0))
  syl2anc(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)), wb(wceq(c3, c4), wral(hs1, c2, wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cfv(c4, cv(hs1))))), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2))
  simp2(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2))
  simp3(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2))
  eqfnfv(hs1, c3, c2, c4)
  diff.hs0.w(w3a(wfo(c0, c1, c2), wfn(c3, c2), wfn(c4, c2)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cfv(c4, cv(hs1))))
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs0))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)))))
  diff.hs0.c(ccom(c3, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(ccom(c4, c0))
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)

blocks.name: fcof1oinvd
blocks.content: Show that a function is the inverse of a bijective function if their composition is the identity function. Formerly part of proof of ~ fcof1o . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm fcof1oinvd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(ccnv(c0), c1))
  -| wi(w0, wf1o(c0, c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c3, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c0, c1), cres(cid, c3)))
} = {
  3eqtr3rd(ccnv(c0), c1, ccom(ccnv(c0), ccom(c0, c1)), ccom(ccnv(c0), cres(cid, c3)), w0)
  coeq2d(ccnv(c0), ccom(c0, c1), cres(cid, c3), w0)
  syl5eqr(ccom(ccnv(c0), ccom(c0, c1)), c1, ccom(ccom(ccnv(c0), c0), c1), w0)
  coass(ccnv(c0), c0, c1)
  eqtrd(ccom(ccom(ccnv(c0), c0), c1), c1, ccom(cres(cid, c2), c1), w0)
  coeq1d(ccom(ccnv(c0), c0), c1, cres(cid, c2), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(ccom(ccnv(c0), c0), cres(cid, c2)), wf1o(c0, c2, c3))
  f1ococnv1(c0, c2, c3)
  syl(w0, wceq(ccom(cres(cid, c2), c1), c1), wf(c1, c3, c2))
  fcoi2(c1, c3, c2)
  syl(w0, wceq(ccom(ccnv(c0), cres(cid, c3)), ccnv(c0)), wf(ccnv(c0), c3, c2))
  syl(w0, wf(ccnv(c0), c3, c2), wf1o(ccnv(c0), c3, c2))
  syl(w0, wf1o(ccnv(c0), c3, c2), wf1o(c0, c2, c3))
  f1ocnv(c0, c2, c3)
  f1of(ccnv(c0), c3, c2)
  fcoi1(ccnv(c0), c3, c2)
}

blocks.name: fcof1od
blocks.content: A function is bijective if a "retraction" and a "section" exist, see comments for ~ fcof1 and ~ fcofo . Formerly part of proof of ~ fcof1o . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm fcof1od(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf1o(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c3, c2, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2)))
} = {
  sylanbrc(w0, wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wf1(c0, c1, c2), wfo(c0, c1, c2))
  syl2anc(w0, wf1(c0, c1, c2), wf(c0, c1, c2), wceq(ccom(c3, c0), cres(cid, c1)))
  fcof1(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  syl3anc(w0, wfo(c0, c1, c2), wf(c0, c1, c2), wf(c3, c2, c1), wceq(ccom(c0, c3), cres(cid, c2)))
  fcofo(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  df-f1o(c0, c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: 2fcoidinvd
blocks.content: Show that a function is the inverse of a function if their compositions are the identity functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: fcof1o
blocks.content: Show that two functions are inverse to each other by computing their compositions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Mar-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: 2fvcoidd
blocks.content: Show that the composition of two functions is the identity function by applying both functions to each value of the domain of the first function. (Contributed by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2fvcoidd(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(ccom(c0, c1), cres(cid, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c3, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, c2, wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  eqtrd(ccom(c0, c1), cres(cid, c2), cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wceq(ccom(c0, c1), cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))))), wf(c0, c3, c2), wf(c1, c2, c3))
  fcompt(hs0, c0, c3, c2, c1, c2)
  syl6eq(cmpt(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))), cres(cid, c2), cmpt(hs0, c2, cv(hs0)), w0)
  mpteq2dva(hs0, c2, cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), cv(hs0), w0)
  imp(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  syl(w0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), cv(hs0))), wral(s0, c2, wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cv(s0))))
  rspccv(s0, c2, cv(hs0), wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  eqeq12d(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s0))), cv(s0), cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), cv(hs0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  2fveq3(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  id(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  mptresid(hs0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0))), cv(hs0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, cfv(c1, cv(hs0)))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm 2fvcoidd(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0 ∘ c1)=(= |` c2))
  ⊣ (w0 →(c1 : c2 → c3))
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c3 → c2))
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s0 ∈ c2,(c0 `(c1 ` s0))= s0))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
} = {
  eqtrd((c0 ∘ c1), (= |` c2), (hs0 ∈ c2 ↦(c0 `(c1 ` hs0))), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, (c0 ∘ c1)=(hs0 ∈ c2 ↦(c0 `(c1 ` hs0))), (c0 : c3 → c2), (c1 : c2 → c3))
  fcompt(hs0, c0, c3, c2, c1, c2)
  syl6eq((hs0 ∈ c2 ↦(c0 `(c1 ` hs0))), (= |` c2), (hs0 ∈ c2 ↦ hs0), w0)
  mpteq2dva(hs0, c2, (c0 `(c1 ` hs0)), hs0, w0)
  imp(w0, hs0 ∈ c2, (c0 `(c1 ` hs0))= hs0)
  syl(w0, (hs0 ∈ c2 →(c0 `(c1 ` hs0))= hs0), ∀(s0 ∈ c2,(c0 `(c1 ` s0))= s0))
  rspccv(s0, c2, hs0, (c0 `(c1 ` s0))= s0, (c0 `(c1 ` hs0))= hs0)
  eqeq12d((c0 `(c1 ` s0)), s0, (c0 `(c1 ` hs0)), hs0, s0 = hs0)
  2fveq3(s0, hs0, c0, c1)
  id(s0 = hs0)
  mptresid(hs0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, (c0 `(c1 ` hs0)), hs0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, (c1 ` hs0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: 2fvidf1od
blocks.content: A function is bijective if it has an inverse function. (Contributed by AV, 15-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2fvidf1od(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wf1o(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c3, c2, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, c1, wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), cv(s0))))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s1, c2, wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c3, cv(s1))), cv(s1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  fcof1od(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  2fvcoidd(s0, c3, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  2fvcoidd(s1, c0, c3, c2, c1, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm 2fvidf1od(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0 : c1 ↔ c2))
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c1 → c2))
  ⊣ (w0 →(c3 : c2 → c1))
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s0 ∈ c1,(c3 `(c0 ` s0))= s0))
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s1 ∈ c2,(c0 `(c3 ` s1))= s1))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  fcof1od(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  2fvcoidd(s0, c3, c0, c1, c2, w0)
  2fvcoidd(s1, c0, c3, c2, c1, w0)
}

blocks.name: 2fvidinvd
blocks.content: Show that two functions are inverse to each other by applying them twice to each value of their domains. (Contributed by AV, 13-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm 2fvidinvd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(ccnv(c0), c1))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c3, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, c2, wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(c0, cv(s0))), cv(s0))))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s1, c3, wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s1))), cv(s1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  2fcoidinvd(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  2fvcoidd(s0, c1, c0, c2, c3, w0)
  2fvcoidd(s1, c0, c1, c3, c2, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm 2fvidinvd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → `' c0 = c1)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c2 → c3))
  ⊣ (w0 →(c1 : c3 → c2))
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s0 ∈ c2,(c1 `(c0 ` s0))= s0))
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s1 ∈ c3,(c0 `(c1 ` s1))= s1))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  2fcoidinvd(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  2fvcoidd(s0, c1, c0, c2, c3, w0)
  2fvcoidd(s1, c0, c1, c3, c2, w0)
}

thm fliftrel(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c0, crn(cmpt(s0, c3, cop(c4, c5))))

  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c3)), wcel(c5, c2))

thm fliftrel(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ⊆(c1 × c2))
  ⊣ c0 = ran((s0 ∈ c3 ↦ < c4, c5 >))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c3)→ c4 ∈ c1)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c3)→ c5 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl5eqss(c0, (c1 × c2), ran((s0 ∈ c3 ↦ < c4, c5 >)), w0)
  frnd((s0 ∈ c3 ↦ < c4, c5 >), (c1 × c2), c3, w0)
  fmpttd(s0, c3, < c4, c5 >, (c1 × c2), w0)
  opelxpd(c4, c5, c1, c2, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c3))
  diff.cxp.s(s0, c1, c2)
}

thm fliftcnv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  relcnv(c0)
  eqrelrdv2(hs0, hs1, ccnv(c0), crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3))), w0)
  3bitr3g(w0, wcel(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), ccnv(c0)), wcel(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3)))), wbr(cv(hs0), ccnv(c0), cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs0), crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3))), cv(hs1)))

  fliftel(s0, cv(hs1), c0, cv(hs0), c1, c3, c2, c4, c5, w0)
  brcnv(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  rexbii(s0, c1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c3)), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c2)))
  ancom(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))
  fliftel(s0, cv(hs0), crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3))), cv(hs1), c1, c2, c3, c5, c4, w0)

  df-br(cv(hs0), crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3))), cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)

  diff.hs1.c(ccnv(c0))
  diff.hs1.c(crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3))))

  diff.hs1.w(w0)

thm fliftcnv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → `' c0 = ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)))
  ⊣ c0 = ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c3, c2 >))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c1)→ c3 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c1)→ c2 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, c5)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  mpancom(w0, `' c0 = ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)), (Rel(`' c0)∧ Rel(ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)))))
  jctil(w0, Rel(`' c0), Rel(ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >))))
  mpisyl(w0, Rel(ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >))), ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >))⊆(c5 × c4), Rel((c5 × c4)))
  fliftrel(s0, ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)), c5, c4, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  relxp(c5, c4)
  relss(ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)), (c5 × c4))
  relcnv(c0)
  eqrelrdv2(hs0, hs1, `' c0, ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)), w0)
  3bitr3g(w0, < hs0, hs1 > ∈ `' c0, < hs0, hs1 > ∈ ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)), hs0[`' c0]hs1, hs0[ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >))]hs1)
  bitr4d(w0, hs0[`' c0]hs1, hs0[ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >))]hs1, ∃(s0 ∈ c1,(hs0 = c2 ∧ hs1 = c3)))
  3bitr4g(w0, hs0[`' c0]hs1, ∃(s0 ∈ c1,(hs0 = c2 ∧ hs1 = c3)), hs1[c0]hs0, ∃(s0 ∈ c1,(hs1 = c3 ∧ hs0 = c2)))
  fliftel(s0, hs1, c0, hs0, c1, c3, c2, c4, c5, w0)
  brcnv(hs0, c0, hs1)
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  rexbii(s0, c1, (hs0 = c2 ∧ hs1 = c3), (hs1 = c3 ∧ hs0 = c2))
  ancom(hs0 = c2, hs1 = c3)
  fliftel(s0, hs0, ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)), hs1, c1, c2, c3, c5, c4, w0)
  eqid(ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)))
  df-br(hs0, `' c0, hs1)
  df-br(hs0, ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)), hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(`' c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)))
  diff.hs1.c(`' c0)
  diff.hs1.c(ran((s0 ∈ c1 ↦ < c2, c3 >)))
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs1.w(w0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: isoid
blocks.content: Identity law for isomorphism. Proposition 6.30(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 33. (Contributed by NM, 27-Apr-2004.)

thm isoid(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wiso(cres(cid, c0), c1, c1, c0, c0)
} = {
  mpbir2an(wiso(cres(cid, c0), c1, c1, c0, c0), wf1o(cres(cid, c0), c0, c0), wral(hs0, c0, wral(hs1, c0, wb(wbr(cv(hs0), c1, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cres(cid, c0), cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(cres(cid, c0), cv(hs1)))))))
  f1oi(c0)
  rgen2a(hs0, hs1, c0, wb(wbr(cv(hs0), c1, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cres(cid, c0), cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(cres(cid, c0), cv(hs1)))))
  bicomd(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wbr(cv(hs0), c1, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(cres(cid, c0), cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(cres(cid, c0), cv(hs1))))
  breqan12d(cfv(cres(cid, c0), cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(cres(cid, c0), cv(hs1)), cv(hs0), cv(hs1), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0))
  fvresi(cv(hs0), c0)
  fvresi(cv(hs1), c0)
  df-isom(hs0, hs1, cres(cid, c0), c1, c1, c0, c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cres(cid, c0))
  diff.hs1.c(cres(cid, c0))
}

thm isoid(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((= |` c0)≅ c1, c1(c0, c0))
} = {
  mpbir2an(((= |` c0)≅ c1, c1(c0, c0)), ((= |` c0): c0 ↔ c0), ∀(hs0 ∈ c0, ∀(hs1 ∈ c0,(hs0[c1]hs1 ↔((= |` c0)` hs0)[c1]((= |` c0)` hs1)))))
  f1oi(c0)

  bicomd((hs0 ∈ c0 ∧ hs1 ∈ c0), hs0[c1]hs1, ((= |` c0)` hs0)[c1]((= |` c0)` hs1))
  breqan12d(((= |` c0)` hs0), c1, ((= |` c0)` hs1), hs0, hs1, hs0 ∈ c0, hs1 ∈ c0)
  fvresi(hs0, c0)

  df-isom(hs0, hs1, (= |` c0), c1, c1, c0, c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)

thm isores2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

blocks.name: isoini2
blocks.content: Isomorphisms are isomorphisms on their initial segments. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Mar-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm isoini2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {

blocks.content: An isomorphism preserves well-foundedness. Proposition 6.32(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 33. (Contributed by NM, 30-Apr-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 18-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm isofr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wb(wfr(c1, c3), wfr(c2, c4)))

  id(wiso(ccnv(c0), c2, c1, c4, c3))

  isof1o(ccnv(c0), c2, c1, c4, c3)
  f1ofun(ccnv(c0), c4, c3)
  funimaex(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0))
  isofrlem(hs0, c2, c4, c1, c3, c0, wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4))
  id(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4))
  3syl(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wcel(cima(c0, cv(hs0)), universe), wf1o(c0, c3, c4), wfun(c0))
  isof1o(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
  f1ofun(c0, c3, c4)
  funimaex(c0, cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(ccnv(c0))

thm isofr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ≅ c1, c2(c3, c4))→(c1[Fr]c3 ↔ c2[Fr]c4))
} = {

blocks.name: f1oiso2
blocks.content: Any one-to-one onto function determines an isomorphism with an induced relation ` S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2013.)

blocks.name: f1owe
blocks.content: Well-ordering of isomorphic relations. (Contributed by NM, 4-Mar-1997.)
blocks.origin:
thm f1owe(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wi(wwe(c3, c2), wwe(c4, c1)))
  -| wceq(c4, copab(s0, s1, wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  biimprd(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wwe(c3, c2), wwe(c4, c1))
  mpan2(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wb(wwe(c4, c1), wwe(c3, c2)), wral(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wb(wbr(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))))
  rgen2a(hs0, hs1, c1, wb(wbr(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))
  brabg(s0, s1, cv(hs0), c1, cv(hs1), c1, c4, wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(s1))), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(s1))))
  breq1d(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  fveq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0)
  breq2d(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs1)))
  fveq2(cv(s1), cv(hs1), c0)
  sylbir(wa(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wral(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wb(wbr(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))))), wb(wwe(c4, c1), wwe(c3, c2)), wiso(c0, c4, c3, c1, c2))
  df-isom(hs0, hs1, c0, c4, c3, c1, c2)
  isowe(c0, c4, c3, c1, c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, cv(hs1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s1, cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c0, cv(hs1))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm f1owe(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ ((c0 : c1 ↔ c2)→(c3 ≤ c2 → c4 ≤ c1))
  ⊣ c4 = { < s0, s1 > |(c0 ` s0)[c3](c0 ` s1)}
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  biimprd((c0 : c1 ↔ c2), c3 ≤ c2, c4 ≤ c1)
  mpan2((c0 : c1 ↔ c2), (c4 ≤ c1 ↔ c3 ≤ c2), ∀(hs0 ∈ c1, ∀(hs1 ∈ c1,(hs0[c4]hs1 ↔(c0 ` hs0)[c3](c0 ` hs1)))))
  rgen2a(hs0, hs1, c1, (hs0[c4]hs1 ↔(c0 ` hs0)[c3](c0 ` hs1)))
  brabg(s0, s1, hs0, c1, hs1, c1, c4, (c0 ` hs0)[c3](c0 ` hs1), (c0 ` s0)[c3](c0 ` s1), (c0 ` hs0)[c3](c0 ` s1))
  breq1d((c0 ` s0), c3, (c0 ` s1), (c0 ` hs0), s0 = hs0)
  fveq2(s0, hs0, c0)
  breq2d((c0 ` hs0), c3, (c0 ` s1), (c0 ` hs1), s1 = hs1)
  fveq2(s1, hs1, c0)
  sylbir(((c0 : c1 ↔ c2)∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ c1, ∀(hs1 ∈ c1,(hs0[c4]hs1 ↔(c0 ` hs0)[c3](c0 ` hs1))))), (c4 ≤ c1 ↔ c3 ≤ c2), (c0 ≅ c4, c3(c1, c2)))
  df-isom(hs0, hs1, c0, c4, c3, c1, c2)
  isowe(c0, c4, c3, c1, c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, (c0 ` hs0), c3, (c0 ` hs1))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, c0, hs1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s1, (c0 ` hs0), c3, (c0 ` hs1))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, c0, hs1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: weniso

  a1i(wa(w3a(wwe(c0, c1), wse(c0, c1), wiso(c2, c0, c0, c1, c1)), wne(crab(hs0, c1, wn(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)))), emptycls)), wss(crab(hs0, c1, wn(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)))), c1))

blocks.name: weisoeq

blocks.name: knatar
blocks.content: The Knaster-Tarski theorem says that every monotone function over a complete lattice has a (least) fixpoint. Here we specialize this theorem to the case when the lattice is the powerset lattice ` ~P A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jun-2015.)
